attributes.action: oblige taxi cab drivers to turn off their engines whilst waiting to collect persons in a effort to reduce carbon emissions across the country.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Taxi cab drivers leave the engine on whilst waiting to pick up customers, solely to keep the meter running. This is a pointless exercise, wasting fuel and increase carbon emissions. A taxi waiting at a pick up point for 5 minutes seems like negligible, but when you consider the taxi is a major means of night time means of transport in a built up area. Five plus minutes multiplied by the number of taxis waiting at an time in a built up area multiplied by the number of built up areas in the country and the sum total of ‘tick over’ minutes quickly escalates to the extreme.
A simple system of a ‘waiting’ button would mean the engine could be switched off and waiting time still recorded. As many companies already employ a system where there vehicles’ engines turn off at lights this is not a ridiculous scheme and would greatly benefit the cause of lowering carbon emissions.
